cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSE of Ocean City, Maryland
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-to-north-northeast parallel to the mid-Atlantic coast and expected to track inland across New Jersey toward southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New Jersey coast (near Cape May)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Maryland or Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Cape May, NJ to Watch Hill, RI including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic coast from the lower Maryland Eastern Shore northward through Delaware, New Jersey and southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible Friday afternoon and evening as the storm passes east of Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (<3 ft) possible along the lower Bay; no significant surge expected in Baltimore Harbor
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain Friday into early Saturday could cause brief urban and poor-drainage flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low, but non-zero risk of an isolated tornado mainly east of I-95; maritime operations may be affected by elevated waves on the lower Bay
